questions.question: Which of these statements would contrast the Maya and Inca civilizations?

choices.answer: The Maya lived in cities and the Inca did not
The Maya had religion and the Inca did not
The Maya had a written language and the Inca did not
The Maya lived in South America and the Inca did not

questions.question: The Mayan calendar was based on their observation of what?

choices.answer: The planets, Sun and moon
The change in the seasons
yearly precipitation patterns
the migration of the birds

questions.question: Incan terrace farming and Mayan floating gardens are examples of?

choices.answer: economic policies that harmed Latin American civilizations
art forms symbolizing the importance of agriculture
slash and burn farming
civilizations adapting to their physical geography

questions.question: The Aztec and Mayan use of zero illustrates that pre-Colombian cultures in the Americas....

choices.answer: Traded extensively with Africa
Made advances in mathematics and science
Declined because of invasion and disease
converted to islam

questions.question: The primary reason for a decline in the native population in Spanish colonies was...

choices.answer: The introduction of European disease
forced labor and capture by slave traders
war casualties during attempts to defeat the Spanish
the collapse of local agriculture

questions.question: The beginning of the age of exploration can be characterized by all of these except..

choices.answer: European dependence on spices from Asia
invention of the compass and astrolab
Existence of muslim empires between Europe and Asia
The development of safe overland routes to Asia

questions.question: The Journey of Da Gama, Magellan, and Columbus were possible because of---

choices.answer: Support of exploration by the English
trade connections established by Ibn Battuta
effects of the Atlantic Slave trade
development of new navigational instruments and technology

questions.question: Which of these best describes the impact of the Colombian Exchange on the lives of Europeans?

choices.answer: Native Americans immigrated to Europe
new products and ideas promoted economic growth
millions of Europeans were killed by new american diseases
New Native American religions declined the churches power

questions.question: The immediate result of Columbus' voyage in 1492 was the...

choices.answer: founding of St. Augustine
defeat of the Aztecs
discovery of a new route to Asia
beginnings of Spanish colonization of the Americas

questions.question: The first permanent English settlement established in the Americas was...

choices.answer: Quebec
Plymouth
Barbados
Jamestown

questions.question: The Middle passage refers to the....

choices.answer: northern route from Europe to Asia
journey of enslaved persons from Africa to the Americas
route from Europe to Asia around the tip of South America
shipments of gold and silver from the Americas to Spain

questions.question: What was a direct result of the Atlantic Slave trade on west Africa?

choices.answer: Animism was no longer practiced in Africa
Many west African communities faced population loss
European industrial factories were established throughout
Africans hired Europeans to train their military

questions.question: The Center of commercial activity had shifted from the Mediterranean to where by the 16 century

choices.answer: The Black sea
The acaspian sea
The Indian Ocean
the Atlantic Ocean
Arabia and the east coast of Africa
the Persian gulf and Eastern Asia
both the Pacific and the Atlantic Oceans
lands in the western Hemisphere

questions.question: One result of the voyages of Zheng he was that ...

choices.answer: Indian artisans showed the Chinese how to make percelain
Chinese merchants began trading with Africa
China set up colonies in Europe
Christian missionaries arrived in China

questions.question: Mercantilism held that the wealth of a nation is measured by its..

choices.answer: Natural resources
Skilled workers
Farmland
Fertile soil

questions.question: Capitalism in a system based on ....

choices.answer: investing for profit
heavy government regulation
lack of government regulation
Strong leadership
